title: Human-Centered AI Design
description: Designing transparent, predictable AI experiences following Microsoft HAX guidelines

principles.title: Make the AIâ€™s role explicit
principles.description: Clearly show when AI is involved and what it does within the interaction flow.

principles.title: Design for uncertainty
principles.description: Expose uncertainty so users understand confidence, risk, and limitations of AI outputs.

principles.title: Provide understandable explanations
principles.description: Explain results in user-facing terms that support decisions, not model internals.

principles.title: Avoid misleading anthropomorphism
principles.description: Avoid human-like cues that inflate expectations or suggest intent or emotions.

principles.title: Preserve user agency
principles.description: Ensure users remain the final decision-makers, with AI acting as support.

principles.title: Enable meaningful user control
principles.description: Let users modify, override, pause, or undo AI actions easily.

principles.title: Support human-in-the-loop interaction
principles.description: Design AI workflows that allow continuous human supervision and input.

principles.title: Handle errors and failures gracefully
principles.description: Communicate AI errors clearly and offer safe recovery paths.

principles.title: Adapt to user context and expertise
principles.description: Adjust AI behavior and feedback to user goals, skills, and situations.

principles.title: Respect user time and cognitive load
principles.description: Reduce mental effort with clear, progressive, and concise AI output.

principles.title: Design for trust and accountability
principles.description: Make responsibility, provenance, and decision ownership transparent.

principles.title: Set appropriate expectations
principles.description: Align messaging with real capabilities to prevent overtrust or misuse.
